page.title: 12Anstruther Fire Service
page.content: 22 years ago the Fire Station moved from the site of Harbourlea to beside Bankie Park. There is 1 engine manned by one of two volunteer crews who are on call alternate weeks. Compared to the last engine, this one is more spacious, more powerful and better equipped. It holds 400gal. of water. The small pump can emit 250gal. per min. while the big pump emits 500. The old brass branches and standpipes are now made of aluminium. The canvas hoses are now made of rubber. There are improved communication systems and breathing apparatus. Instead of bells individual bleepers are used to call out the crew. The heavy black suit has been replaced by lightweight yellow, oilskin trousers, a velcro fastening Nomex jacket and a yellow helmet. The station serves an area from Kingsbarns to Arncroach & Pittenweem.
